comment: Easy class, easy A, and a nice professor. He even removed 1 or 2 of the modules during finals week or to make it up to us for not putting grades in on time. Read the assigned readings, try your best with the discussion posts and essays, and you'll do great

comment: Don't take if you are not an English major

comment: Easy and organized weekly modules, lots of material, but there aren't frequent assignments or quizzes to keep up with on top of the reading material. Lectures are helpful, and he cares about the material he's covering. Easy to communicate with. Can't recommend this professor enough
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: the work is simple and clear. The reading are light and very manageable. he is very understanding as long as you communicate any issues you have. 100% would take again

comment: I love Prof. Watson! This is my second time taking a class with him and I'm planning on taking him again. No homework, only some in-class work, midterm, final test, and final paper. Really wants his students to understand and engage with the work rather than just memorize it. Super nice guy! If you have the chance, take his class.

comment: No papers, and Dr. Watson obviously cares about the materials. There are quite a few poems. 2 open-note online exams, and he tells you what will be on it before hand. He grades fair and accepts late work for -1 pt per week late. He also gives great feedback.
Mostly graded on discussion posts and VoiceThreads. He gives good feedback and a clear idea of what he is expecting. Only two tests, midterm and final. Overall, great professor and very nice.

comment: The tests were really lengthy and on top of that he doesn't accommodate his students to take the test some other day. Not super lenient with grading either.

comment: A fairly easy class. Most of the time you only have one assignment to turn in on Thursdays. A lot of reading and lectures, you really only need to read the piece the assignment is over. Some times he will even cancel the work for the week as a reward for good work. He is such an easy and understanding online prof. His finals/midterm is also easy.

comment: Professor Watson was a wonderful teacher that always made insightful comments on every discussion post. His lectures were interesting and easy to understand while also being helpful to gain a better understanding of the texts. No textbook required as all works were provided through PDfs or found online. Weekly discussion posts and two tests.

This was a really fun class! Most of the work consisted of analyzing poetry and writing a discussion about it. You did have to read a few longer stories but nothing major. The exams are super easy as well, they are open note and all you really have to do is rewrite your discussions you made throughout the semester. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: There were weekly discussion posts and he provides the poems or texts and records 10-20 minute lectures. His midterm and finals are pretty easy and he provides good feedback after each assignment. Nice guy and really passionate about english which makes the class interesting.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: i love dr. watson!! his classes are definitely tough, but this is the fourth class i've taken with him and i've never gotten anything other than a high A. he's accessible and super helpful! he even changed a few grades early in the semester because of a miscommunication. take him!! he's great and it's an easy course if you do the reading/work!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: i love dr. watson!! he's a great professor. weekly discussions, and responses aren't always required. this was a poetry based class with one film in the final week. midterm and final are writing based, but not difficult at all if you read the material and watch lectures. i'm taking him again next semester! highly recommend!

comment: What a wonderful man :) Every lecture is an uplifting and meaningful discussion. The assignments are digestible and fun (when they aren't, he'll let you know). He knows his stuff, he's humble, and he's kind. If you want to learn about American Lit in particular, he's a perfect professor to help you explore whatever topics you enjoy. Take him!

comment: A couple hours of work each week, not difficult. He is easy to reach with questions and is very nice and understanding. Recorded lectures are great. As long as you read material and watch lectures, tests are easy
rating_tags: Respected

comment: I was truly inspired by Professor Watson. Each class we have these deep, meaningful discussions about the texts we read and the authors. It is beautiful the way he talks about literature. comment: Take him!!! I have taken him for three classes and he is literally the picture perfect example of a sweet old man. He has so much passion and it is so obvious that he adores his job. comment: I'm gonna be straight, this class is boring. Unless you just love old poets then this class will interest you. However, even though it is boring I would take Professor Watson. His class is not very much work and an easy A.

comment: Professor Watson is one of my favorite professors. I've taken him twice (and will be again next semseter). He is incredibly chill, which is really reflected in the classroom environment. We had 3 essays throughout the class and blog posts (discussion posts) after most readings, but all of the criteria is very straightforward. Highly recommend!

comment: A nice guy and kind grader, but completely monotone and fluent in Academese. Had him for a 2000 and now 4000 level class. Feels like I'm not learning anything useful. comment: Craig is the Bob Ross of professors. I love the more hardcore profs, but Craig is the ideal. So long as you engage with the material and do the reading, youll get an A. Not an easy A, but a fair A. His enthusiasm for the subject is immense and also very helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Watson is such a great teacher! Make sure you read the books so you can participate in class! It is appreciated by the other students and the professor! I would take Dr. Watson again. rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: This man is incredible! I took him for American Lit and I've never experienced English like this. He really has me wanting to take more English classes just for the love of the subject now. He really knows what he's talking about and the class discussions were great. Class consists of blog posts, interpretive writing assignment, midterm, final.

Dr. Watson is literally amazing. He's very knowledgeable, and he cares about his students. He gives midterm and final as well as a final paper, but overall it's very laid back as long as you read what is assigned. 10/10 would recommend, will take again!

comment: Dr. Watson is an excellent professor. If you really pay attention and participate in his lectures, it's likely that you'll do well in this class. He loves discussions! comment: He is a good professor, he cancels class a lot. However, he is very slow to email back, which is a huge pain when you have an urgent question.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Watson is the best. His love for literature is contagious. If you don't take him you are missing out. He makes you WANT to come to class.
Dr. Watson is awesome. He actually cares about literature and his students. As long as you come to class, read, and participate you will be fine. I will take him as long as I'm at KSU.

I absolutely adore Dr. Watson. He is incredibly kind and exudes his life passion through his lectures. This is my second semester with him, and you better believe I will take any class I can with him until I graduate. It is not because you can get an easy A (if you participate and do the work), but because he makes literature interesting.

Dr. Watson is amazing. If you read, go to class, and participate, you'll be fine because you will retain so much of the information for the test. It's a primarily discussion-driven class instead of being a lecture-based course, so participation is really important. He's pretty straightforward about the course. I enjoyed it.

I've taken Watson for several different classes and try to take him every semester. He's by far my favorite professor in the English department. No matter what class you're taking he's extremely nice & helpful & a very fair grader. Read what he assigns and take notes in class and you will do well. I get an A in every one of his classes, trust me.

Dr. Watson is by far, my favorite professor here at KSU! He is very laid back and understanding. He is always there to help you with whatever you need.. and he sincerely loves the topics covered. Such a great teacher and a sweet guy!

Professor Watson was one of the best teachers I have ever had. I would love to take more classes from him. He is very laid back, attendance is not required (although I never wanted to miss his lecture anyway), and he is just an overall kind person. I took him for 2145 and 2160 and both classes were great.

I have taken Watson twice now and still find that he is my favorite professor at ksu. He is laid back and engages the class in discussions about the diverse literature we read for the course. He is wise, friendly, and helpful. I hope to take him again in the future.

Dr. Watson truly cares about the subject and is excited to share his love of literature with the class.  He is gentle and wise and positive.  If you want to enter into the English department, his class is a great beginning.
As an undergrad in the English program at KSU, I can honestly say, Watson is simply the best.
One of the best teachers ever!!! I would take him for every English class if I could.

Had for American Lit. Survey. I really enjoyed the class. The readings were not very difficult. We read two books, several short stories, and a few poems. Your grade is determined by a midterm, final, a critical analysis essay, and several online reading journal entry's. Overall an easy, low stress class!

loved this class and i don't even like reading. he makes world lit really fun and interesting! just make sure you READ THE BOOKS. its pretty hard to keep up in class if you don't know what's going on. overall, he is a great guy and i enjoyed coming to this class. i highly recommend!

Very nice guy! He's the quiet type, but really funny and facilitates great discussions. He chooses a wide range of literature, so you are bound to like something you study in the class. I am studying to be an English teacher, and I love his teaching style. One of my favorite teachers at KSU! I highly recommend him!

Great professor. Do not have to write 1 paper only blog entries that have to be 400 words i think we had 4 in all & only 2 test, easy class! readings are very interesting i enjoyed all of them and ended the semester with a movie! class was boring at times but pay attention and take good note bc that is what the blog and finals are going to be over

Very laid back.  He wants you to enjoy literature, so he encourages everyone's viewpoint. He chooses are wide array of works, so you feel cultured. My only negative thoughts are that he does not grade for grammar and spelling, and I think that as an English professor, he should. Even my non-English classes grade for it. Super nice guy, though.

It is easy to fall behind in reading- be careful. Every class is a (boring) discussion, so missing a few doesn't affect you too much. Make sure you go on review day. He basically gives what the topic of every question will be. He looks for specific answers that he wants to hear, so take note of the important key notes he repeats and stuff.

This guy is really funny and easy to understand. He has opinions and likes discussing them. The only thing I didn't like is that the class felt like it was nothing but talking the WHOLE time, and since I'm not an aural learner, it sucked sometimes. Just go to class, read the material, take notes, and you'll be fine!

What an awesome professor! I enjoyed his class and his teaching style so much I'm taking him in the fall, too! His class isn't a cake walk, you do have a fair amount of reading and papers, but he is still an awesome professor! Take him if you can - you wont regret it!
Amazing class! Professor Watson is one of the nicest, sweetest teachers you can hope for.

Hands down the best professor in the dept. Lots of little writing assignments, & one presentation. He gives useful feedback, and is always willing to help with any questions/issues you have. Overall a very easy class with a very good professor.

Very nice man. Easy class - supposed to introduce you to the major. Lots of reading but great selections. Grades involve a running reading blog and several papers. Offers help for everything, even deadlines. Good class overall.
Great teacher. Fun class. Knows his stuff. I recommend this teacher to everyone who loves to write. It will bring your creativity and motivation back.
Take this class!! Watson is amazing! His assignments aren't too demanding (ten poems and one book review), and your poetry is practically gauranteed to improve if you take Watson's advice.
Watson is an amazing teacher. He is very laid back, teaches in a clear, interesting style and knows what he is talking about. Great class, take him!

He is the best lit teacher I have ever had. There is a lot of reading but when you come to class he explains everything perfectly. His tests are all essay but they are really good questions and easy to answer.
Dr. Watson is the best lit teacher I have ever had. All you have to do to pass his class his listen to his lecture and take a few notes. He makes everything very easy to understand.
Poetry Workshop Instructor:  enthusiastic, knowledgeable, pleasant, high-standard, good control of class, great sense of humor, very engaging and motivating-- A+ instructor.

I had a great time in Watson's Poetry class.  He's fun because he explores writings in depth and takes everyone's viewpoint.  He's very liberal when it comes to individual writing and I just loved the class overall!

I thoroughly enjoyed having Dr. Watson for my lit teacher. Not only is he very understanding, but the class is not at all dificult...as long as you come to class and listen to his interpretations of the literature (take notes), you are pretty much guaranteed an A. I strongly recommend taking him.

This was a poetry class. I liked him because he gave clear instructions for poetry allowed extra time to post it later. He sounds a little like Ben Stein so he's boring, but he knows his voice is flat (he said so) and he reads some great poetry.
Watson is the man. Makes class comfortable and interesting. Chooses great literature to read from and clarifies everything. TAKE THIS CLASS.

I loved this class! There are only 3 tests and one essay; pay attention in class and you will do well. A lot of people complained about the religious/philosophical texts that we read (Hebrew, Christian, Confucian, etc.) so only take this class if you aren't afraid of, you know, being educated and/or a little cultured.
Very intersting class.
No Comments

He is nice and tells corny jokes but who doesn't.  For this class, we have no exams, just projects and papers.  We have group assignments with presentations.  If you are interested in writing, then this is the class to take.
He's awesome. Low key, and humorous.

Very interesting class- if you're interested in English and interpretation. He likes to do poetry so there isn't a ton of reading. His tests are all essay but if you listen in class and are of average intelligence, you'll get a good grade. I would recommend him to a serious English major.
